deflist.deflst: "Bank" means National Bank of Abu Dhabi (NBAD), its successor(s) and or assignee(s);
"Ministry" means the Ministry of Finance of United Arab Emirates
"Cardholder" means a person in whose name a Card Account as defined below is maintained by the Bank;
"Card" means the Bank and the Ministry’s e-Dirham G2 Gold Al Haslah Prepaid Card issued to the Cardholder;
"Card Account" means the account maintained by the Bank in relation to any Card purchases, cash withdrawals, and any other charges applied to Cardholder's Card;
"Balance" means the funds available for use on a Card that is net of payments made in to Card a/c and amount used + the fee & commission applied by the Bank;
"PIN": mean a personal identification number selected by the Cardholder;
"Activation": Code means the number printed on the receipt of the first Card load to enable you to set your “Passcode”.
"Passcode":   means the number made up of 8 digits used to log on to the e-Dirham website, access the call center services and proceed with online payment.
